title: Colloquialisms 1
sentences: Stop tiring me out with this nonsense!
I don't get this joke, explain it!
I'm really into this new style!
Don't lie, I know you weren't there!
This movie really hit the spot, I haven't seen such a good one in a long time.
I'm totally done/exhausted from this heat.
Don't freak out/worry, everything will be fine at the exam!
This food is really good/hits the spot, let's order more!
He/she really took on/braved this daring task.
Stop talking nonsense/giving me that deaf talk!
I got a scolding/black mark from the boss again.
This car is really top-notch/on point.
We're just chilling with the buddies on the weekend.
Stop throwing a tantrum/being hysterical, it's not a big deal!
This kid is a real brainiac, he knows everything.
The penny should finally drop for him!
This place is really cool/awesome, let's stay longer!
Stop stirring/complicating things, tell the truth!
I was totally floored/blown away by the news.
We messed this up/blew it, we can start over.
Don't mess/pick with me, because I'll get angry!
I'm really into this girl/she's my type.
We're just rotting/vegging out in front of the TV all day.
Don't talk back/interrupt when someone else is talking!
dictionary:
fáraszt - to bore/tire someone with nonsense
vág - to get/understand (slang)
bead - to be into/dig something (slang)
kamuzik - to lie/bullshit
üt - to hit the spot/be impactful
kész - exhausted/done
parázik - to freak out/worry
adja - it's good/it's on point
bevállal - to take on/brave something
süket duma - nonsense/BS
gáz - embarrassing/uncool
flekk - a scolding/reprimand
ott van a szeren - top-notch/high quality
lazul - to chill/relax
hisztizik - to be hysterical/throw a tantrum
agyas - brainy/intelligent
leesik a tantusz - the penny drops/to finally understand
király - cool/awesome
kavar - to stir trouble/complicate things
lehidal - to be floored/blown away
elkúr - to mess up/screw up (vulgar/informal)
szívózik - to mess with/harass someone
bejön - to be attracted to/like someone
döglik - to veg out/lie around lazily
dumál - to talk/chat (informal)
